intro: Coussapoa planitiensis, commonly known as the Brazilian bellflower, is a rare flowering plant native to the Atlantic rainforests of Brazil. It is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has a woody stem and produces small, oval-shaped leaves with a glossy surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and is protected in several conservation areas.
